newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool indicator rises 1c to 567c/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool indicator rises 1c to 567c/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market eastern indicator rose by one cent to 567 cents a kg clean at sales in Melbourne on Monday, Wool International (WI) said.
Merino fleece prices were mixed, with the 19/20/21 micron indicators 0.5 percent dearer.
The 22m category was slightly cheaper while 23/25m were slightly dearer. The 24m category was unchanged while 26m was fully firm, WI said.
In crossbreds, 27m was unchanged, 28/30m up to 0.5 percent cheaper, 29m fully firm and 31m 1.0 percent cheaper, it said.
WI said Japanese and Chinese interests were principal buyers with support from Taiwan and Western Europe.
Of 8,545 bales offered, 7.2 percent were passed in.
Sales continue on Tuesday in Goulburn and Melbourne with about 19,800 bales to be offered.
